results.title: Adrian
results.creator_credit: Allan Kidston and Victoria. Office of Intellectual Disability Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early Intervention Series”.
Adrian shows how children with developmental delay can be successfully integrated in kindergarten with cooperation between parents, kindergarten staff and the Early Intervention Program.

results.title: Approaches in early intervention
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Office of Intellectual Disabilities Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early Intervention Series”.
This video looks at the history of Early Intervention, how it provides information, support and resources to families along with individual development programs in order to promote their child’s development. The different types of services are looked at as well as showing the importance of assessment. This program is one of a series on Early Intervention.

results.title: On the Right Track
results.brief_description: A Department of Conservation, Forests and Lands Program. Examines the Code of Forest Practices which was set to ensure careful logging use of our valuable forests to protect them for future generations.

results.title: The Builders
results.creator_credit: James Fitzpatrick and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: An outline is shown of the aid which Australia is giving to her neighbours in South-East Asia under the Colombo Plan. Assistance under the Colombo Plan is given to peoples of all nations and all creeds to help them become self-sufficient technically and economically. Narration by Don Crosbie.

results.title: Grassed chutes
results.creator_credit: R.G. Downes and Cambridge Film Production
results.brief_description: Explains the grassed chute as a devise for preventing erosion: an eroding vertical gully head can be converted into a gently sloping and well-grassed surface over which water can flow without damage to the soil. Shows types of gullies where the grassed chute control could not be used. Describes with simple animated diagrams all stages of planning and construction of the chutes.

results.title: Like other people
results.creator_credit: Paul Morrison, Irving Teitelbaum and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: This film depicts many aspects of the lives of handicapped adults living in a residential home run by the Spastic Society. It centres on the lives of Willie and Margaret, and shows their desire for as normal a life as possible. Highlights the need to carefully consider how society treats disabled people. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Integrating disabled children into regular schools (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Joe Dora and Chisholm Institute of Technology. School of Education
results.brief_description: Integrating disabled children into mainstream schools throughout Australia requires careful thought and action on the part of the disabled, their parents, teachers and all concerned. This video presents the thoughts of these people in discrete segments suitable for discussion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joe Dora and Chisholm Institute of Technology. School of Education

results.title: Paul Bocuse. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Didi von Rossek and Aida United
results.brief_description: Internationally recognised as one of the greatest living chefs, Paul Bocuse was made a member of the Legion d’Hooneur in recognition of his services as an ambassador of French cuisine. In this video he includes clear, step-by-step instructions for making Coq au Vin and Baked Apples. The ingredients are printed following each recipe. Bocuse’s love and joy for cooking and teaching cooking are clearly evident.
results.description: Internationally recognised as one of the greatest living chefs, Paul Bocuse was made a member of the Legion d’Hooneur in recognition of his services as an ambassador of French cuisine. results.title: Paul Bocuse. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Didi von Rossek and Aida United
results.brief_description: These programs present Paul Bocuse’s favourite recipes for real food cooked at home in the simplest ways. From the first menu to the last, the six menus are all perfectly balanced; some simple and homely cuisine, others more elegant and elaborate. All the recipes are easy, with short, clear instructions that anyone can follow. Once you know how to prepare these meals you will be ready every occasion, especially as the recipes are accompanied by Paul Bocuse’s advice on how to vary the ingredients depending on the season, sensible shopping, etc. In this video he includes easy instructions, and printed guidelines for buying the necessary ingredients for both Veal Kidney Roast and Chocalte Mousse.
